This one is garenteed explosions and you don't need to know how to build a good designer. Here's the story: Gene Kerman decided it would be beneficial for the space center to go under a quote "catastrophe simulation" for failed launches and attacks from rouge and evil kermans. He puts you in charge of build a craft of destruction and gives you the guidelines and a map of the space center marked up in many colors. You must build either a rocket or a plane that can rain simulated death and destruction onto the space center without hitting the flags and injuring and or killing any of the kerbals on site. He does give you permission to destroy any vehicles parked in the marked areas. Here are the guidelines:

Rules of engagment:

Must design a plane or a rocket not both.

Must contain at a minimum one kerbal of your choice.

You must show that have tweaked your rocket/plane in some fashion.

You are only allowed infinite fuel and part clipping.

If you use any mods you will be placed in a completely separate division from the full stock rockets/planes.

A weapon is defined as a small part of your rocket/plane that is only attached at one point and can leave your rocket/plane at anytime.

Once you have used all your weapons you must successfully abort with your kerbal in one piece.

You must provide either photo evidence of everything or a video. If you just hand me the craft file I will not count it.

You may submit multiple times only if you are doing both a stock rocket/plane and a moded rocket/plane.

Scoring:

This map will help.

Every time a weapon hits in the target zone you get that point.

You may do multiple runs at this but do not that the more you do the lower your score will be.

The math here is simple: (((Hit points in round 1 - Black area hit points in round 1) * weapon count multiplier) + (round 2 total)...) * round multiplier = final score.

Example:

I did this in one round and from what I could tell I my score is as follows

((32+6+20-0)*0.5)*2=58

You will most likely do better.

Good luck!
